name: BEST WESTERN Le Jardin de Cluny

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Chose this hotel due to some of the good reviews on Trip advisor.
reviews.title: Good location, clean and quiet.

reviews.text: Stayed in room 301, superior double room and we were very pleased with the standard. Very clean and modern and quiet. Air con worked well. Hotel staff very helpful and polite and spoke very good English.
reviews.title: Location a plus

reviews.text: Easy to get to via metro and RER. Would definetley return. Would recommend trying the bistro Maree Vert located close by as recommended by the hotel receptionist. Great three course meal for 34euros a head, great service and ambience. All in all very pleased, had a great time.
reviews.title: Very pleasant stay

reviews.text: We stayed at the cluny for 5 nights got a really good deal on one of the websites, booked it after reading the excellent reviews. The hotels location was excellent , rooms average, staff very helpful, Tea/coffee can be requested when booking. Could not fault hotel in any way great value for money. Would most certainly recommed the Le Jardin De Cluny Hotel. Thank you to the staff for making are stay a very comfortable one.
reviews.title: OK stay

likes.disliked: — Staff tried to get more money from me

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We chose this hotel for the location, a short walk from Notre Dame and all the activity of the Latin Quarter. It is also convenient to several metro stations.
reviews.title: Good experience

reviews.text: A friend from Australia booked this online. I was meeting them and I just went along and booked the same hotel (so I could stay at the same place.) I was pleasantly surprised.
reviews.title: Great service and definitely a must for budget travellers

likes.disliked: — tiny rooms and no tea/coffee making facilities in room - but were given kettle when I asked

reviews.text: The staff spoke english very well, were very helpful and very pleasant.
reviews.title: My favourite hotel in Paris

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The location is very central to all the major sight seeing points and walking distance to many good cafes and restaurants.
reviews.title: Very Enjoyable stay

likes.disliked: — Air con turned off for winter even though weather was mild

reviews.title: nice hotel very friendly staff good location although room a littel small
reviews.text: The internet rates were very reasonable and the little lounge downstairs was great if you wanted to have a drink after hours or just have a tea/coffee.

reviews.title: Some problems
reviews.text: Would definitely recommend this place for budget travellers. Just a note - the elevator to my room (on the 2nd floor) was ok, but friends of mine (on the 5th floor) had to take a tiny elevator that only fit 1

A fantastic hotel with incredibly helpful, friendly staff. Lovely rooms, great bathrooms, good breakfasts. Great location - walking distance to St Germain d'Prix, buses, Metro. Longer walk to Musee d'Orsay, Louvre and more. Exceptional staff.
reviews.title: Wonderful service

likes.disliked: — French rooms are v small by Australian standards

reviews.text: We just got back from a three day visit to paris, our first trip. The
reviews.title: Nice Choice for a sightseeing

reviews.text: hotel was chosen over the internet based upon reviews as well as location.....The staff was very helpful and friendly. We had booked a
reviews.title: good little hotel

likes.disliked: — dripping sound when it rained, tiny tiny elevator

reviews.text: triple room and we given one of the family rooms on the top floor. Everything hotel related is smaller in Paris and this was no exception, though we had two seperate beds and lots of closet and bath space. The room was comfortable with two rooftop windows that looked out on , well, other rooftops. It was nice to get some outside
reviews.title: Great location and unbeatable price for Paris Weekend

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: air later in the day beyond the usual air conditioning. The decore was interesting, dark colors with lilly floral wallpaper, but clean and well kept.
reviews.title: fantastic hotel in the centre of paris,excellent location

reviews.text: We spent a week at the Jardin de Cluny in the "family room" on the top floor. I would highly recommend this room in particular if you have a group of three or four (or even five if one doesn't mind sleeping on a cot). The room itself was spacious, as was the newly renovated bathroom. I took a peek inside other rooms in the hotel and they were minuscule by comparison.
reviews.title: Perfect for Family Vacation

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Service was friendly and efficient. The only problem was a delay of about two hours before check-in- which seemed much longer because of our jetlag.
reviews.title: Great Location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The location is wonderful. You are just steps away from Place Maubert, which has several cafes and bakeries. There is also a Metro stop right at the corner. My favorite Paris museum, the Cluny Museum, is only a block away. Several days there was a great street market in the square with an interesting mix of food vendors and artisans.
reviews.title: Charming hotel, good location

likes.disliked: — Slight street noise, otherwise no complaints

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We never had breakfast in the hotel. I did take a look at the breakfast room, which is quite nice in spite of the fact that it is in the sub-basement. I still cannot imagine why anyone would choose the expensive hotel basement breakfast over one of the cafes in the neighborhood.
reviews.title: Perfect location

reviews.text: Overall, I would recommend this hotel. It was a good value, well situated, and had friendly staff. If you are looking for a clean, comfortable, pleasant base from which to explore Paris the Jardin de Cluny is a good choice.
reviews.title: Small, smelly room, with rude staff

aka: Best Western Le Jardin De Cluny Hotel
description: In a quiet street in the heart of the Latin Quarter, the BEST WESTERN LE JARDIN DE CLUNY is the perfect location to discover Paris. Saint Germain-des-Près, the Louvre and the Cluny Museums, Notre-Dame de Paris are very close.In a warm and contemporary ambiance, we look forward to assisting you, and to making your stay in Paris as pleasant and memorable as possible.For your comfort, the hotel is 100% non-smoking and eco-friendly.
